title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil. Add the spaghetti and cook until al dente.
While the pasta is cooking, heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add the pancetta and cook until crispy, about 5-7 minutes.
In a bowl, whisk the eggs and mix in the grated cheeses, leaving some for garnish. Season with a generous amount of black pepper.
Once the pasta is cooked, reserve 1/2 cup of the pasta water, then drain the pasta.
Working quickly, add the hot pasta to the skillet with the pancetta, remove from heat, and toss to combine.
Add the egg and cheese mixture, tossing quickly to coat the pasta. The residual heat will cook the eggs into a creamy sauce. If needed, add a splash of the reserved pasta water to loosen the sauce.
Serve immediately, topped with additional grated cheese and freshly ground black pepper.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken (tikka) cooked in a smooth buttery & creamy tomato based gravy.
ingredients: 800g boneless chicken, cut into bite-sized pieces
instructions: In a large bowl, mix 1 cup yogurt, lemon juice, turmeric, 2 tsp garam masala, cumin, ginger, and garlic to make a marinade.
Add chicken pieces to the marinade, ensuring each piece is well coated. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, preferably overnight.
Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Thread marinated chicken onto skewers and place on a baking sheet. Bake for 15 minutes or until chicken is just cooked through.
Meanwhile, heat oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add onions and cook until soft and translucent.
Add tomato puree, remaining garam masala, and salt. Simmer for 15 minutes until sauce thickens.
Stir in the remaining yogurt and cream. Cook on low heat for 5 minutes.
Add the baked chicken pieces to the sauce and simmer for another 5 minutes.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve hot with naan bread or rice.

title: Vegetable Stir Fry
summary: A quick and healthy dish with colorful vegetables tossed in a savory sauce.
ingredients: 1 tbsp cornstarch dissolved in 2 tbsp water
instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat.
Add garlic and ginger, stir-fry for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add the vegetables in order of cooking time: carrots first, followed by broccoli, then bell peppers, snap peas, and finally mushrooms.
Stir-fry for 5-7 minutes until vegetables are crisp-tender.
In a small bowl, mix soy sauce, hoisin sauce, and sesame oil.
Pour the sauce mixture over the vegetables and toss to coat evenly.
Add the cornstarch slurry and stir quickly as the sauce thickens.
Garnish with sesame seeds and green onions before serving.

title: Classic Beef Burger
summary: Juicy beef patty with fresh lettuce, tomato, and special sauce on a toasted bun.
instructions: In a large bowl, combine ground beef, salt, pepper, Worcestershire sauce, grated onion, and garlic. Mix gently with your hands, being careful not to overwork the meat.
Form the mixture into 4 equal-sized patties, slightly larger than your buns as they will shrink when cooking. Press a small dimple in the center of each patty to prevent it from puffing up.
Heat a skillet or grill to medium-high heat. Cook the patties for 4-5 minutes on each side for medium doneness, or adjust cooking time to your preference.
During the last minute of cooking, place a slice of cheese on each patty to melt.
While the burgers are cooking, mix mayonnaise, ketchup, and mustard to create the special sauce.
Lightly butter the cut sides of the buns and toast them until golden brown.
To assemble: Spread special sauce on the bottom bun, add lettuce, a burger patty with melted cheese, tomato slices, pickles, and red onion. Top with the other half of the bun.
Serve immediately with fries or a side salad.

title: Berry Smoothie Bowl
summary: A refreshing blend of mixed berries topped with granola, nuts, and fresh fruit.
ingredients: 1 cup frozen mixed berries (strawberries, blueberries, raspberries)
Toppings: granola, sliced fresh fruits, chia seeds, nuts, shredded coconut
instructions: Add frozen berries, banana, yogurt, milk, and sweetener (if using) to a blender.
Blend until smooth and creamy. The mixture should be thick enough to eat with a spoon. If it's too thick, add a bit more milk. If too thin, add more frozen fruit.
Pour the smoothie mixture into a bowl.
Arrange toppings in sections over the smoothie base: granola, fresh berries, sliced banana, chia seeds, nuts, and coconut.
Serve immediately while cold.

title: Shrimp Pad Thai
summary: Stir-fried rice noodles with shrimp, eggs, bean sprouts, and crushed peanuts.
ingredients: 1 tsp sriracha or chili sauce (adjust to taste)
instructions: Soak the rice noodles in hot water according to package instructions until they are soft but still firm. Drain and set aside.
In a small bowl, whisk together all sauce ingredients until the sugar is dissolved.
Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a large wok or skillet over medium-high heat. Add shrimp and cook for 2-3 minutes until they turn pink. Remove and set aside.
Add another tablespoon of oil to the wok. Add garlic and stir-fry for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Push the garlic to one side of the wok and add the beaten eggs to the other side. Scramble the eggs until just set, then mix with the garlic.
Add the soaked noodles and pour the prepared sauce over them. Toss everything together for 2-3 minutes until the noodles absorb the sauce.
Add the cooked shrimp back to the wok along with bean sprouts and half of the green onions. Stir-fry for another 1-2 minutes.
Remove from heat and transfer to serving plates. Top with crushed peanuts, remaining green onions, and cilantro.
Serve with lime wedges on the side.

title: Avocado Toast
summary: Toasted sourdough bread topped with mashed avocado, salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes.
ingredients: Optional toppings: poached egg, cherry tomatoes, feta cheese, microgreens
instructions: Toast the sourdough bread slices until golden brown and crispy.
Cut the avocado in half, remove the pit, and scoop the flesh into a bowl.
Add lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Mash with a fork to your desired consistency (chunky or smooth).
Spread the mashed avocado evenly over the toast slices.
Sprinkle with additional salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes to taste.
Add optional toppings as desired: halved cherry tomatoes, crumbled feta cheese, a poached egg, or a handful of microgreens.
Serve immediately while the toast is still warm and the avocado is fresh.

title: Chocolate Lava Cake
summary: Warm chocolate cake with a gooey molten chocolate center, served with vanilla ice cream.
ingredients: Butter and cocoa powder for preparing ramekins
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C). Butter four 6-ounce ramekins and dust with cocoa powder, tapping out excess.
In a microwave-safe bowl, combine chocolate and butter. Microwave in 30-second intervals, stirring between each, until melted and smooth.
In another bowl, whisk together eggs, egg yolks, and sugar until light and frothy, about 2-3 minutes.
Fold the chocolate mixture into the egg mixture until combined.
Gently fold in flour, cocoa powder, and salt until just incorporated. Be careful not to overmix.
Divide the batter evenly among the prepared ramekins.
Place ramekins on a baking sheet and bake for 12-14 minutes until the edges are firm but the centers are still soft.
Allow to cool for 1 minute, then carefully run a knife around the edges and invert onto serving plates.
Dust with powdered sugar and serve immediately with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.
